Less than two years after being released from federal prison, the Philadelphia Eagles quarterback is making his fourth Pro Bowl appearance- and first since serving 18 months for his role in a dogfighting operation. This one feels great due to the fact that I've been through so much and trained to getting back to this position, he said after the NFC opened practice Wednesday. people give him credit for." Though Dermot O'Leary admits he enjoys working with Simon Cowell , he and the rest of the people who work with the music mogul hate to let him down. He added: Don't get me wrong, he's still my boss, but he's sort of a Victorian father- you'd hate to let him down. On the occasion that happens I literally feel sick. has joined the Defending Social Security Caucus newly organized by fellow Democratic Sen. Bernie Sanders of Vermont. "Social Security has not contributed a dime to the debt or the deficit," he said, calling the program rock-solid for at least another 27 years. That was a reference to the moment when Social Security's trustees project that the system's trust fund-- financed by payroll taxes that are segregated from other federal levies-- will run out.
